result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey A Olson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Intentionally Abuse Hazardous Substance, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.316(2)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

*Submit DNA Sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffrey A Olson

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Count 1:  Withheld Sentence and Placed on Probation 
Count 2:  Withheld Sentence and Placed on Probation 
Count 3:  Withheld Sentence and Placed on Probation 
Count 4:  Dismissed and Read In
Count 5:  Dismissed and Read In

Defendant Jeffrey A Olson in court.  Attorney Taylor O Soule in court for Jeffrey A Olson.  Attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Cases heard at this time are 21CF-297, 21CM-171, 21CM-194 and 22CF-67.

9:44 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Cassidy state appearances.

This is a plea and sentencing hearing.

Plea Questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
21CM-171: Defendant will plead to Count 1. Ct 2 will be dismissed and read in.
21CM-194: Defendant will plead to Count 1 and Count 3. Count 2 will be dismissed and read in.
21CF-297: Defendant will plead to Count 1.
22CF-67: Defendant will plead to Count 1 and Count 2 and Count 3. Count 4 and Count 5 will be dismissed and read in.

State moves to dismiss the modifier in 22CF-67.

BY THE COURT:
Court will strike the domestic abuse enhancer in Count 1 of 22CF-67.

Attorney for defendant concurs with agreement stated.
Defendant understands the agreement.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
21CM-171: Count 1: No Contest. 
21CM-194: Count 1: No Contest. 
21CM-194: Count 3: No Contest. 
21CF-297: Count 1: No Contest. 
22CF-67: Count 1: domestic abuse enhancer striken: No Contest.
22CF-67: Count 2: No Contest.
22CF-67: Count 3: No Contest.

Court indicates that an information has not been filed in 22CF-67.
Atty Cassidy replies, one was prepared but not submitted.
State will submit the information.
Atty Soule is prepared to go forward, knowing information will be filed as stated on the record. 

Court questions defendant regarding plea questionnaire, waiver of constitutional rights and understandings.
Court advises defendant of elements the state must prove for the charge.
Court questions attorney for the defendant.
Court finds defendant's plea is freely, voluntarily, knowingly, and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty of 21CM-171, Count 1; 21CM-194, Count 1 and Count 3; 21CF-297, Count 1; 22CF-67, Count 1 and Count 2 and Count 3. 
Clerk directed to enter judgment of convictions this date.
21CM-171: Count 2: Dismissed and read in. 
21CM-194: Count 2: Dismissed and read in.  
22CF-67: Count 4: Dismissed and read in.
22CF-67: Count 5: Dismissed and read in. 

State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes in each file.
No victims are present.

Atty Cassidy makes sentencing arguments to the court, this is a joint recommendation.
Atty Soule makes sentencing arguments to the court. 
Court verifies open cases in other counties.
Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.
Court appreciates comments.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT: 
21CM-171:
Count 1:
Sentence is Withheld.
Probation for a period of 24 months.
3 days jail credit.
Conditions:
AODA Assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.
Complete a domestic violence program if one is available.
Do not abuse any hazardous substance.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances. 
Maintain absolute sobriety.
No contact with Menards in Plover.
No contact with Walmart in Plover.
Contact with A.O. only as deemed appropriate by the agent.
Comply with any other assessments and treatments and counseling deemed appropriate by the agent.
Pay DNA Surcharge.
Submit DNA Sample.
Pay costs and surcharge.
 
21CM-194:
Count 1:
Sentence is Withheld.
Probation for a period of 24 months.
2 days jail credit.
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in 21CM-171.
Pay DNA Surcharge.
Submit DNA Sample.
Pay costs and surcharge.

21CM-194:
Count 3:
Sentence is Withheld.
Probation for a period of 24 months.
2 days jail credit.
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 1 and 21CM-171.
Pay DNA Surcharge.
Submit DNA Sample.
Pay costs and surcharge.

21CF-297:
Count 1:
Sentence is Withheld.
Probation for a period of 36 months.
2 days jail credit.
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in  21CM-171 and 21CM-194.
Pay DNA Surcharge.
Submit DNA Sample.
Pay costs and surcharge.

22CF-67:
Count 1:
Sentence is Withheld.
Probation for a period of 36 months.
82 days jail credit.
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in  21CM-171 and 21CM-194 and 21CF-297.
Pay DNA Surcharge.
Submit DNA Sample.
Pay costs and surcharge.

22CF-67:
Count 2:
Sentence is Withheld.
Probation for a period of 24 months.
82 days jail credit.
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 1 and  21CM-171 and 21CM-194 and 21CF-297.
Pay DNA Surcharge.
Submit DNA Sample.
Pay costs and surcharge.

22CF-67:
Count 3:
Sentence is Withheld.
Probation for a period of 24 months.
82 days jail credit.
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 1 and Count 2 and 21CM-171 and 21CM-194 and 21CF-297.
Pay DNA Surcharge.
Submit DNA Sample.
Pay costs and surcharge.

BY THE COURT:
Each probation term is concurrent to one another.

Atty Cassidy addresses the Court as to term of probation.
Court replies.

BY THE COURT:
Day report is terminated.
Probation can transfer to Manitowoc County.
Violation Report. Filed by JusticePoint - S Varga.
Violation Report. Filed by JusticePoint - S Varga.
Violation Report. Filed by JusticePoint - C Amundson.
Plea/Sentencing Hearing set for 08/19/22 - moved, left no address
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-Trial Conference set for 05/09/22 - moved, left no address
Pre-trial conference on May 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-Trial Conference set for 04/25/22 - not deliverable as addressed

10:18 AM Defendant Jeffrey A Olson appeared by video, in custody at the Waupaca County Jail.  Attorney Taylor O Soule for Jeffrey A Olson appeared in court, Attorney Kelly A Cassidy for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. 

ADA Cassidy calls the case and states the appearances.

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Arraignment on March 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
BY THE COURT: On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Bond continued.

02:03 PM Defendant Jeffrey A Olson appeared by video. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Brian Pfeil appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney (Atty)  Taylor O Soule in court for Defendant Jeffrey A Olson.
  Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.  Arraignment scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

08:31 AM Attorney (Atty) Taylor O Soule in court. Defendant Jeffrey A Olson appeared by video. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kelly A Cassidy appeared for State of Wisconsin.

Motion for Bond Modification
Court has received the motion. 
Atty Soule relies on the assertions in the motion.  
Atty Cassidy makes arguments in opposition to the motion. 

BY THE COURT: 
Court believes the cash bond previously set is appropriate to assure court appearances and defendant has been unable to comply with conditions of bond.
Motion is denied for the reasons stated on the record.
Waiver of Preliminary Examination filed by Atty Taylor Soule
Notice of Motion and Motion for Modification of Bond filed by Atty Taylor Soule (sent to Br 1 Judge/JA on 02/02/22 sp)

records.addlTxt: Initial Appearance set for February 7, 2022 @ 1:15 p.m. in Br 2
Do not consume or possess any intoxicating inhalent. Comply with conditions of all open bonds.

Assistant District Attorney (ADA)  Andy Mutchler appears in court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video. 
Attorney (Atty) Taylor Soule appears in court for defendant. 

1:17 PM Court calls case.
Atty Mutchler states appearances.

ADA Mutchler states facts for anticipated charges of bailjumping and Possession of hazardous substance and retail theft.
Atty Soule respresents this person on his other cases, will take this case.
Atty Soule states that this Defendant does qualify for representation from the public defender's office.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

State requests a cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Soule addresses the Court regarding bond.

Initial Appearance scheduled for: February 7, 2022   @ 1:15  p.m.  in Branch 2
